title: How to tell my teachers that I think I have ADHD - Quora

response.answer_text: You DON’T! You should leave your teacher out of it. Read on. To do it correctly, you must be diagnosed by those who have the professional credentials and can diagnose ADHD properly. Remember that everyone has some components of ADHD. Anyone can get screened for ADHD and will score somewhere on the bell curve. It isn’t until the bell curve score becomes really significant that ADHD enters the realm of a disability. Honestly, if you really think you may have it, then talk to your doctor about getting diagnosed properly. S/he can give you a referral to a clinic that specializes in such disorders and THEY can give you a positive diagnosis. Only then will you hve any leverage with your teachers. This is because they hear every excuse in the book for students not performing and ADHD is the most popular excuse EVER. They will need to see some serious proof.

Ask your mum to make an appointment with your GP & discuss the difficulties you are experiencing. If the GP considers you need an assessment, they will refer you. You can also get referred by the school to see a school psychologist who can do an assessment on you. If you are diagnosed with ADHD/ADD, then it won’t be necessary to inform your teachers as they will already be informed via the psychologist. I wouldn’t recommend telling your teachers that you ‘think’ you have ADHD, if you have not been diagnosed.

This is a conversation for your family, parents if you are a minor. There are self report score sheets that are valuable. I suggest ADDitide magazine as a great starting point. This should be completed by two people who know you well. Then you go to your MD and plan from there.
You print the ADHD symptoms, you highlight the ones that correspond to your experience, and you ask for their support. Good luck! Cheers!
